popt4jlib

Class DblArray1SparseVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.DblArray1SparseVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, SparseVectorIntf, VectorIntf
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DblArray1SparseVectorMT

    public class DblArray1SparseVector
extends java.lang.Object
implements SparseVectorIntf
    sparse double[] implementation of VectorIntf, maintaining two arrays, an index array, and a values array. Useful when dealing with very high-dimensional vectors that are sparse to a significant degree (e.g. in Information Retrieval, one may create vectors in 50.000 dimensions, but each vector may have only a few tens or hundreds of non-zero components). Notice that getCoord/setCoord operations can be much more costly than the same operations when operating with a DblArray1Vector (where the operations are O(1) -constant time simple memory accesses). Notice also that the class is not thread-safe, i.e. none of the methods can be considered as reentrant in a multi-threaded environment. This choice is made for speed considerations. Clients must therefore ensure on their own that the application is race-condition free when using this class. A thread- safe version is DblArray1SparseVectorMT (which also parallelizes some of the methods) in this package.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    See Also:

      • getCoord

        public double getCoord(int i)
                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        return the i-th coordinate of this VectorIntf (i must be in the set {0,1,2,...getNumCoords()-1}). Has O(log(_ilen)) worst-case time-complexity where _ilen is the (max.) number of non-zeros in this vector.
        Specified by:
        getCoord in interface VectorIntf
        Parameters:
        i - int
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i is not in the set mentioned above

      • setCoord

        public void setCoord(int i,
            double val)
              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                     ParallelException
        set the i-th coordinate of this VectorIntf (i must be in the set {0,1,2,...getNumCoords()-1}). Repeated calls to this method for indices not in the original contruction of this vector will eventually destroy its sparsity. Has O(_ilen) worst-case time-complexity where _ilen is the (max.) number of non-zeros in the array. The time-complexity reduces to O(log(_ilen)) if the element to be set, is already non-zero before the operation.
        Specified by:
        setCoord in interface VectorIntf
        Parameters:
        i - int
        val - double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i is not in the set mentioned above
        ParallelException - -never throws this exception
